titleStmt.title: The foundation of God, with the immutability thereof laid for the salvation of his elect; with infallible marks and signs of election. Which may serve as a storehouse of comfort to religious minds, in this season of danger felt and feared.
titleStmt.author: Crompton, William, 1633-1696.

titleStmt.title: The foundation of God, with the immutability thereof laid for the salvation of his elect; with infallible marks and signs of election. Which may serve as a storehouse of comfort to religious minds, in this season of danger felt and feared.
titleStmt.author: Crompton, William, 1633-1696.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for James Cowse bookseller in Exeter,

notesStmt.note: A reissue, with cancel title page and added dedication leaf (pi1-2), of the edition with "printed for Robert Clavell" in imprint (Wing C7031A).
Reproduction of original in the Henry E. Huntington Library.
